intro: Schoberia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive variation in leaf shape and size, which can range from linear to ovate depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid climates. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
